IDI : 80 Persen Rumah Sakit Mengalami Tunggakan Pembayaran BPJS
02 Nov 2019, 18:17 by Fitratun KOmariah


IDI : 80 Persen Rumah Sakit Mengalami Tunggakan Pembayaran BPJS

KBRN, Jakarta : Wakil Ketua Umum Pengurus Besar Ikatan Dokter Indonesia (PB IDI) Moh. Adib Khumaidi memperkirakan bahwa 80 persen mitra rumah sakit yang telah bekerja sama dengan Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan mengalami tunggakan dalam pembayaran.
Saat ini rumah sakit yang bermitra dengan BPJS Kesehatan berjumlah 2.520.
“Saat ini 80 persen rumah sakit sudah bekerja sama dengan BPJS, kemudian mengalami tunggakan di dalam pembayaran bpjs. Ini menjadi hal yang sangat krusial, kualitas yang akan kita berikan juga akan berdampak,” ujar Moh. Adib di Jakarta, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Adib mengapresiasi dengan kebijakan pemerintah yang menaikkan iuran BPJS. Namun, dirinya masih ragu jika kenaikan BPJS tidak serta-merta meningkatkan kualitas pelayanan kesehatan yang baik.
“Karena konsep (kenaikan BPJS) sekarang, hanya berbicara terkait konsep menangani defisit,” tutur Adib.
Adib juga prihatin kepada teman-teman dokter di daerah yang belum dibayarkan gajinya. Namun, ia menilai hal ini sudah menjadi kebiasaan dalam sistem JKN.
“Teman-teman di seluruh rumah sakit, bahkan di daerah sudah menangis dengan kondisi saat ini. Ada yang sekiabn bulan belum dibayar, dan dampaknya ke SDM. Dokternya pun belum dibayar, tapi kami udah terbiasa karena kami sangat mendukung program JKN,” keluhnya.
Adib berharap pemerintah bisa menutup semua defisit keuangan BPJS Kesehatan dan nantinya akan me-redesign sistem Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional.
“Awal langsung tutup semua, kemudian kita re-design JKN, kita sehatkan JKN, kita memperbaiki connecting dan sebagainya. Tapi, tutup dulu itu, karena itu akan berdampak seperti gali lubang, tutup lubang,” tegasnya.

IDI: 80 Percent of Hospitals Experience Arrears in Payment of BPJS
02 Nov 2019, 18:17 by Fitratun KOmariah


IDI: 80 Percent of Hospitals Experience Arrears in Payment of BPJS

KBRN, Jakarta: Deputy Chairperson of the Indonesian Medical Association (PB IDI) Executive Board Moh. Adib Khumaidi estimates that 80 percent of hospital partners who have collaborated with the Health Insurance Administration Agency (BPJS) have experienced arrears in payments.
At present there are 2,520 hospitals that partner with BPJS Health.
"At present 80 percent of hospitals have collaborated with BPJS, then experiencing arrears in the payment of bpjs. This is a very crucial thing, the quality we will provide will also have an impact, "said Moh. Adib in Jakarta, Saturday (11/02/2019).
Adib appreciated the government policy which raised BPJS fees. However, he is still doubtful if the increase in BPJS does not necessarily improve the quality of good health services.
"Because of the concept (increase in BPJS) now, only talking about the concept of dealing with deficits," said Adib.
Adib is also concerned about doctor friends in the area whose salary has not been paid. However, he considered this to be a habit in the JKN system.
"Friends throughout the hospital, even in the regions, are crying with the current conditions. Some have not been paid for a month, and the impact is on HR. The doctor hasn't been paid yet, but we are used to it because we really support the JKN program, "he complained.
Adib hopes the government can cover all BPJS Health financial deficits and will redesign the National Health Insurance system.
"Initially, everything was closed immediately, then we re-designed JKN, we made JKN healthy, we improved connecting and so on. But, close it first, because it will have an impact like digging a hole, closing the hole, "he stressed.
